items.title: A Sandwich Shop, a Tent City and an American Crisis
items.abstract: As homelessness overwhelms downtown Phoenix, a small business wonders how long it can hang on.

items.title: Cities big and small are finding innovative ways to keep small businesses afloat.
items.abstract: Across the country, local governments are sending out small grants to their small businesses even though their budgets are already devastated, with some cities expecting revenue shortfalls of 20 percent. But city councils, mayors and governors see this help as a matter of survival.

items.title: New Rochelle: When a Smaller City Fits
items.abstract: Home to around 80,000 residents across 13.2 square miles, the city has nine miles of coastline and a wide variety of housing stock.

items.title: Bookshelf | In Architecture, Small is Big
items.abstract: A new book from Taschen, “Small Architecture Now!”, explores innovative buildings with diminutive footprints.

items.title: Big City, Small Town
items.abstract: Which would you rather live in? Why?
